Also, level indicators, alarms, and switches are installed in key points within the system to monitor the supply of liquid ammonia and to ensure that a vessel is not overfilled.  The facility has installed ammonia sensors in the Engine Room and Cold Storage Areas.  The ammonia detection system in the Engine Room has two setpoints: WARN - Alarm at computer system and page operators and ALARM - Engine room refrigeration equipment shutdown.  The Cold Storage Area ammonia detection system has a single setpoint which, if reached, will alert operators to the situation via the computer control system. 

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Based upon the Dreisbach Hazard Assessment Update Report (04/16/2024), there have been no reportable releases of ammonia at the facility over the past five years (April 2019 - April 2024).

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The facility has an Emergency Action Plan (plan) in effect at the facility.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:  

1. save lives;
2. minimize and avoid injuries;
3. protect the environment; and
4. minimize property damage.

The Plan provides the notification procedures and evacuation routes for emergencies that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated as needed to ensure accuracy.  Facility personnel receive annual training regarding the emergency procedures.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

In order to operate the ammonia refrigeration system, the facility complies with the following risk management regulations:

1) OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM);
2) EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP); and
3) OES California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program.

These regulations impose numerous requirements on the facility to ensure the safety of the public and on-site workers.  The following summarizes the key compliance programs that have been implemented by Dreisbach to prevent the accidental release of ammonia from the facility.  The Operating Procedures program ensures that the ammonia system is operated in a safe manner.  The Training program ensures that personnel fully understand how to perform their jobs in a safe manner.  The Mechanical Integrity program ensures that the ammonia system is in proper working condition based upon routine testing, inspections, and maintenance according to manufacturer's specifications and industry standards.  The Management of Change program ensures that process modifications are implemented in a safe manner.  The Pre-Startup Safety Review program ensures that adequate safety measures are in place before ammonia is introduced into a process.  The Hot Work Permit program ensures that Dreisbach's employees and contractors perform hot work (e.g. welding) in a safe manner.  The Contractor Safety program ensures that contractors understand the hazards of ammonia and must take specified precautions to safely complete job requirements.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Dreisbach Enterprises is a northern California based company, providing complete warehouse and logistics capabilities at a cold storage facility located in Richmond, California.  

Dreisbach's senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but to also maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  Dreisbach's safety and environmental policies are administered by senior staff including the President, who participates in quarterly inspections of each facility to ensure compliance, and oversees the safety and environmental programs with assistance from operations personnel.  These programs include hazard communications, lockout/tagout, Hazardous Materials Emergency Business Plan, employee safety manuals, manufacturers documentation, Emergency Action Plan, as well as the Risk Management Plan.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

Dreisbach's Richmond facility is located at 3151 Regatta Blvd., California approximately 0.2 miles south of the 580 freeway exit at Marina Bay Parkway.  The facility and the refrigeration system began operation in the early 1960s.  The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban.

The primary business of Dreisbach is to provide refrigerated warehousing and storage. Note that this location also rents space to tenants.
